com.ace.lewissketch
Class Octants

java.lang.Object
  com.ace.lewissketch.Octants
All Implemented Interfaces:
LsConstants
 class Octants
extends Object
implements LsConstants

The area around an atom is divided into directional octants (N, S, E, W, etc.) into which bonds, lone electrons and a charge may be placed. The purpose of this class is to keep track of where bonds are placed, determine where electrons and the charge are placed, and display the electrons and charge for an atom.

Field Detail

loneElectrons

private Electrons loneElectrons
Holds x, y coordinates of the electrons of this atom's octants.

bondCount

private int[] bondCount
Counts of number of bonds in each octant. Extra array element prevents index out-of-bounds in some algorithms, allowing the algorithms to be simpler and more efficient. The value of the last element is not used.

electronCount

private int[] electronCount
Counts of number of electrons in each octant. Extra array element prevents index out-of-bounds in some algorithms, allowing the algorithms to be simpler and more efficient. The value of the last element is not used.

chargeOctant

private int chargeOctant
Octants in which to display charge.

allOctantsFull

private boolean allOctantsFull
Are all octants full of bonds?

FILL_ORDER_OFFSETS

private static final int[] FILL_ORDER_OFFSETS
Octants are filled with electrons by finding a starting octant, then proceeding according to the order given in this array, whose values are offsets from the start octant. The first offset should always be 0 so that filling actually starts in the start octant. example: if fillStartOctant = 3, then the order for filling octants is: {3,5,1,7,4,2,6,0}

fillOrderIndex

private int fillOrderIndex
Current index of FILL_ORDER_OFFSETS[] array.

placeLoneElectrons

void placeLoneElectrons(double[] center,
                        double scaleFactor)
Given the x,y coordinates of the center of the atom, place the lone electrons around the atom ("place" means "determine their x,y coord.")

Parameters:
center - coordinates of this atom's center
scaleFactor - how far away from the center of the atom the electrons need to be

placeVerticalOctants

private void placeVerticalOctants(double[] center,
                                  double scaleFactor)
Given atom center, place electrons in north and south octants (determine their x,y coordinates). Since drawing electrons in these octants is almost identical, these two are combined. Electrons are actually placed in alternating octant order (one north, one south, one north, one south) as "mirrored pairs", the only difference being their Y coordinate.

Parameters:
center - coordinates of this atom's center
scaleFactor - how far away from the center of the atom the electrons need to be

placeHorizontalOctants

private void placeHorizontalOctants(double[] center,
                                    double scaleFactor)
Given atom center, place electrons in east and west octants. Since placing electrons in these octants is almost identical, these two are combined. Electrons are actually placed in alternating octant order (one east, one west, one east, one west) as "mirrored pairs", the only difference being their X coordinate.

Parameters:
center - coordinates of this atom's center
scaleFactor - how far away from the center of the atom the electrons need to be

placeCrossOctant

private void placeCrossOctant(double[] center,
                              int octantNum,
                              double scaleFactor)
Place the electrons in a non-vertical, non-horizontal octant (NE, SE, NW, SW) given the atom center (x,y), the number of electrons to be placed in the octant, the octant#, and a scale factor. The x/y factors should be 1 or -1 and are multiplied against distance offsets (so a distance is changed in a positive or negative direction). Here is a handy table for values of the factors:
xFactyFactOctants
11NE
1-1SE
-1-1SW
-11NW

Parameters:
center - coordinates of this atom's center
octantNum - the octant number
scaleFactor - how far away from the center of the atom the electrons need to be

                       int centerX,

graph - the graph of the molecule

centerY - y-coordinate of this atom's center

findChargeOct

int findChargeOct()
Determines the octant where charge is placed (if there is a charge).

findChargeOct

int findChargeOct(boolean forMView)
Determines the octant where charge is placed (if there is a charge). Place in octant with no bonds if possible. Upper right octant (SE unless being created for MarvinView) is preferred and default. NEVER place in left, right, or lower right (E, W, or NE (SE for MarvinView)) octant by order of the gods of Chemistry.

Parameters:
forMView - whether this drawing will be displayed in MarvinView

getChargeCoords

double[] getChargeCoords(int[] center,
                         double scaleFactor)
Gets the coordinates of the charge from atom's coordinates and the octant.

Parameters:
center - the center coordinates of the atom
scaleFactor - the scaling factor for display in MarvinView
Returns:
the coordinates of the charge

isCrossOctant

private boolean isCrossOctant()
Gets if the charge is in a cross octant (NE, SW, etc.).

Returns:
true if the charge is in a cross octant

int[] getChargeOffset()

reportChargeChange

void reportChargeChange(int oldCharge,
                        int newCharge)
Determines the octant where charge is placed/removed and redistributes the lone electrons if necessary.

Parameters:
oldCharge - the old charge
newCharge - the new charge

reportAddedBond

void reportAddedBond(int[] myCenter,
                     int[] bondedAtomCenter)
Given x,y coordinates of center of this atom and the atom being bonded, along with the number of lone electrons for this atom, the octant of the new bond relative to this atom is determined, and the corresponding bond count is incremented. In case a bond is being added to an octant where none was before, also re-distributes electrons and charge.

Parameters:
myCenter - the coordinates of the center of the atom
bondedAtomCenter - the coordinates of the center of the atom to which this atom is being bonded

reportDeletedBond

void reportDeletedBond(int[] myCenter,
                       int[] bondedAtomCenter)
Given x,y coordinates of center of this atom and the atom being unbonded, along with the number of lone electrons for this atom, the octant of the new bond relative to this atom is determined, and the corresponding bond count is decremented. In case a bond is being added to an octant where none was before, also re-distributes electrons and charge.

Parameters:
myCenter - the coordinates of the center of the atom
bondedAtomCenter - the coordinates of the center of the atom to which this atom is being unbonded

getOctant

int getOctant(int[] center,
              int[] point)
Given the center of this atom and a point, returns octant of the given point relative to this atom's center.

Parameters:
center - coordinates of this atom's center
point - coordinates of the point

distributeElectrons

void distributeElectrons()
Distributes current number of lone electrons into octants around the atom. Basic Algorithm:
  • if all octants have bonds, simply place electrons starting at S, 2 at a time in each octant, until all are full. Repeat placing pairs clockwise until all electrons are placed
  • if at least one octant has no bond, place electrons in non-bond octants as far away from bonds as possible. Fill all available octants with pairs before adding more than one pair per available octant. Never place lone electrons in same octant as a bond.
Start with octant "furthest" from bonds (middle of biggest set of octants without bonds - a "gap").

middleOfWidestOctantGap

private int middleOfWidestOctantGap()
Find the middle of the widest GAP (no bonds) of octants around the atom.

Returns:
the octant in the middle of the widest octant gap; if all octants have bonds, returns S

startIndex - the index of the first octant

redistribute

void redistribute(int[][] bondedAtoms,
                  int[] center,
                  int charge,
                  boolean forMView)
Completely reconfigure octants given array of (x,y) coordinates of all atoms bonded to this atom, this atom's center, #lone electrons, and charge.

Parameters:
bondedAtoms - coordinates of atoms bonded to this one
center - coordinates of this atom's center
charge - the charge
forMView - whether this drawing will be displayed in MarvinView; if so, disallowed charge octants may be different
